00001 /**************************************************************************
00002 $Header: wn_log.c Sun 11-19-2000 10:48:25 pm HvA V1.00 $
00003 Disk logging routines
00004 HISTORY: 920919 V1.0    
00005 ***************************************************************************/
00006 
00007 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00008                         HEADER FILES
00009 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00010 #include <stdio.h>
00011 #include <stdlib.h>
00012 #include <stdarg.h>
00013 #include <string.h>
00014 #include "window.h"
00015 
00016 static int indent_len = 0;
00017 static char indent_str[80];
00018 
00019 
00020 /*#+func-----------------------------------------------------------------------
00021     FUNCTION: wn_log_indent()
00022      PURPOSE: Set indent in window stream loggin
00023       SYNTAX: int wn_log_indent(int i);
00024  DESCRIPTION: int i: Number of spaces to add to indentation
00025      RETURNS: 0 if all OK, -1 if error occured.
00026      HISTORY: 920919 V0.1
00027 --#-func----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00028 int wn_log_indent(int adjust_len)
00029 {
00030  int i;
00031 
00032  /*----------------------------------
00033    Adjust number of spaces to indent
00034  -----------------------------------*/
00035  indent_len += adjust_len;
00036 
00037  /*-----------------------------------------------------
00038    Check on valid indent lenght: 0 <= indent_len <= 40
00039    return 0 if OK, -1 if not
00040  -----------------------------------------------------*/
00041  if (indent_len < 0)
00042    indent_len = 0;
00043  if (indent_len > 40)
00044    indent_len = 40;
00045 
00046  /*-----------------
00047    Set the string
00048  -----------------*/
00049  i = 0;
00050  while (i < indent_len)
00051    indent_str[i++] = 0x20;
00052  indent_str[i] = '\0';
00053 
00054  return(0);
00055 
00056 }
00057 
00058 /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
00059    FUNCTION: wn_log()
00060     PURPOSE: Log window actions to a log file
00061      SYNTAX: void wn_log(char *format, ...);
00062 DESCRIPTION: If 'WN_LOG' is defined, a file called 'window.log' will be
00063              opened. The arguments given will be printed in the logfile.
00064              The format of the arguments is the same as for 'printf()'.
00065     RETURNS: nothing
00066     HISTORY: 920203 V0.1 - Initial version
00067 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00068 void wn_log(char *format, ...)
00069 {
00070   va_list arguments;
00071   static char *ep = NULL;     /* Points to environment var that names file */
00072   FILE *fp = NULL;
00073 
00074   if (ep == NULL                /* First time through, just create blank file */
00075   && (ep = getenv("WN_LOG"))
00076   && (fp = fopen(ep,"w")) ) {
00077     fclose(fp);
00078     fp = NULL;
00079     indent_str[0] = '\0';
00080   }
00081 
00082   if (ep)  {                     /* If we have a filename, proceed */
00083     fp = fopen(ep,"r+");
00084     if (!fp) {
00085       fprintf(stderr,"\nCannot open %s\n\a",ep);
00086       return;
00087     }
00088     else {
00089       va_start(arguments,format);       /* va_... housekeeping             */
00090       fseek(fp,0L,SEEK_END);            /* position pointer on end of file */
00091       fprintf(fp,"%s",indent_str);      /* place indentation               */
00092       vfprintf(fp,format,arguments);    /* print the log message           */
00093       fclose(fp);                       /* close the file                  */
00094     } va_end(arguments);                /* va_... housekeeping             */
00095 
00096   }
00097 }
